intro: Sium oppositifolium, commonly known as water parsnip, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often near water bodies. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Sium oppositifolium is often found in temperate regions of North America and parts of Eurasia.
